Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1945
Description: In 1945, to commemorate the Allied victory, Baron Philippe de Rothschild had the idea of embellishing the Mouton Rothschild label with art-work: in this instance, a symbolic return of peace. He commissioned this from young unknown artist, Philippe Jullian. Having displayed early promise as a designer. This label is based on the famous 'V for Victory' that Churchill used throughout the war to rally the forces of freedom.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1947
Description: Label art by Jean Cocteau - Novelist, dramatist, painter and designer, but primarily a poet.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1947
Description: Label art by Jean Cocteau - Novelist, dramatist, painter and designer, but primarily a poet.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1948
Description: Label art by Marie Laurencin - She drew a pair of young bacchantes, endowing them with a typically childlike gravity.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1949
Description: Label art by Andre Dignimont - Parisian painter has drawn the inside of a country pub for his label - one of the best vintages of the century.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1950
Description: Label art by Georges Arnulf

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1951
Description: Label art by Marcel Vertès - shepherd and shepherdess.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1952
Description: Label art by Leonor Fini - A young 'She-Ram' demonstrates her capacity by sheer elegance and precision of her drawing, to lift everyday reality into the world of dreams.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1952
Description: Label art by Leonor Fini - A young 'She-Ram' demonstrates her capacity by sheer elegance and precision of her drawing, to lift everyday reality into the world of dreams.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1953
Description: Centenary Commemorative label - showing contemporary portrait of Baron Nathaniel.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1954
Description: Label art by Jean Carzou - The allegory of the Wheel of Fortune reminds us that however generous, Nature, even at Mouton Rothschild, is never predictable.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1955
Description: Label art by Georges Braque - Celebrating a magnificent vintage with the simplicity of a great artist. Features in last scene of 'Diamonds are Forever' James Bond movie (1971)

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1955
Description: Label art by Georges Braque - Celebrating a magnificent vintage with the simplicity of a great artist. Features in last scene of 'Diamonds are Forever' James Bond movie (1971)

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1956
Description: Label art by Pavel Tchelitchew - 'La Tache de Vin' returns to the traditional theme of the Ram, expressing exuberance of nature under the controlling hand of man.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1957
Description: Label art by André Masson, for the label he created a hymn in praise of contented drunkenness, where the figure of the slumbering drinker is intertwined with branches of the vine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1957
Description: Label art by André Masson, for the label he created a hymn in praise of contented drunkenness, where the figure of the slumbering drinker is intertwined with branches of the vine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1960
Description: Label art by Jacques Villon - capturing the movement of the birds in the static geometry of the vines.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1961
Description: Label art by Georges Mathieu - explosive dynamism of his work for the label - typical of his style.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1961
Description: Label art by Georges Mathieu - explosive dynamism of his work for the label - typical of his style.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1963
Description: Label art by Bernard Dufour - Grapes and a recumbent human figure, with a line from Mallarmé's L'Après-midi d'un faune - 'Ainsi, quand des raisins j'ai sucé la carté...' (Just so I sucked once the lustre from the grapes.)

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1964
Description: Label art by Henry Moore - Three golden chalices cradled in cupped hands, evokes the solemn mood of some ancient ritual.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1965
Description: Label art by Dorothea Tanning - 'She-lambs' true to her inspiration, a world of gracefully drifting dreams.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1966
Description: Label art by Pierre Alechinsky - The 'Ram-Drinker' powerful but full of humour, seems to almost to leap off the bottle.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1966
Description: Label art by Pierre Alechinsky - The 'Ram-Drinker' powerful but full of humour, seems to almost to leap off the bottle.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1967
Description: Label art by César Balaccini - makes use of present-day artefacts: paper clips, nuts and bolts.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1967
Description: Label art by César Balaccini - makes use of present-day artefacts: paper clips, nuts and bolts.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1969
Description: Label art by Joan Miró - Dominated y a vast, blood-red grape, his label includes a discreet but witty obeisance to the family: the blue and yellow of the Rothschild racing colours.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1970
Description: Label art by Marc Chagall - Synthesis of the Jewish and Russian cultural traditions, half-realistic, half-symbolic Rather than wine, it was the living fruit of the vine, speared by a thrush or fed by a mother to her child. The 1970 vintage took second place, and was the highest ranked French wine, at the historic 1976 Judgment of Paris wine competition.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1973
Description: Label art by Pablo Picasso - The year 1973 marks the world of art with the death of the Spanish artist Pablo Picasso. To pay homage to him, Baron Philippe de Rothschild decided that one of the emblematic paintings made by Pablo Picasso, and from his personal collection, will be the label of Château Mouton Rothschild 1973.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1975
Description: Label art by Andy Warhol - Juxtaposing different studies of Baron Philippe.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1982
Description: Label art by John Huston - one of the last pictures he painted. Sensual, graceful, using deep, warm colours, it returns in representational style to the symbolic theme of the Ram, leaping in dionysiac joy, accompanied by its inseparable companions, the sun and the vine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1989
Description: Label art by artist, Hans Georg Kern Baselitz - The two upside-down rams on the Mouton Rothschild 1989 labels are associated with the shocking event of 1989: the demolition of the Berlin Wall. Around the heraldry are the words “Drüben sein jetzt hier” – “Over there is now over here” a new and reunited Germany.

Description: Label art by Setsuko - Retells in her own way the story of wine: The bunch of grapes that once was blossom and became fruit, full as an ear of wheat at harvest time; then, in the end, the wine in the decanter and the pleasure of drinking it.

Description: Label art by Per Kirkeby - Outline of a gigantic wine glass, overflowing with dark red wine, set against a distorted landscape where the rays of the sun mesh and interweave with the colour and intersecting perspectives of the vines.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 1993
Description: Label art by Balthus - the dreamy adolescent girl, wilful, graceful and fragile...All the hypnotic power of style that is both limpid and full of mystery, leading us away to distant lands of fantasy and desire. The pencil drawing of a nude reclining nymphet was rejected for use in the United States by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms,as such, for the U.S. market the label was made with a blank space where the image should have been and both versions are sought after by collectors.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2000
Description: For the year 2000, which celebrates the new millennium, Baroness Philippine de Rothschild did not commission a painter. In fact, the bottle itself is a collector’s item for this year. The glass is adorned with a treasure from the Museum of Wine in Art at Mouton: the little “Augsburg Ram”. The ram is the estate’s symbol and is in the family crest. The estate called the glass manufacturer B.S.N. for this special edition with a new technique of enameling in relief. A golden ring around the black foil mimics the design engraved on the ram’s collar and recalls the chased volutes of its body. As a proof of authenticity the Château Mouton Rothschild name is engraved in the base.

As a proof of authenticity the Château Mouton Rothschild name is engraved in the base.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2000
Description: For the year 2000, which celebrates the new millennium, Baroness Philippine de Rothschild did not commission a painter. In fact, the bottle itself is a collector’s item for this year. The glass is adorned with a treasure from the Museum of Wine in Art at Mouton: the little “Augsburg Ram”. The ram is the estate’s symbol and is in the family crest. The estate called the glass manufacturer B.S.N. for this special edition with a new technique of enameling in relief. A golden ring around the black foil mimics the design engraved on the ram’s collar and recalls the chased volutes of its body. As a proof of authenticity the Château Mouton Rothschild name is engraved in the base.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2001
Description: Label art by Robert Wilson - for the label Wilson chose to represent Baroness Philippine de Rothschild in multiple colour schemes in which the green of the vine shoots and the gold of the sun harmonizes with the chromatic scale of the wine, form light red to deep purple.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2001
Description: Label art by Robert Wilson - for the label Wilson chose to represent Baroness Philippine de Rothschild in multiple colour schemes in which the green of the vine shoots and the gold of the sun harmonizes with the chromatic scale of the wine, form light red to deep purple.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2001
Description: Label art by Robert Wilson - for the label Wilson chose to represent Baroness Philippine de Rothschild in multiple colour schemes in which the green of the vine shoots and the gold of the sun harmonizes with the chromatic scale of the wine, form light red to deep purple.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2002
Description: Label art by Ilya Kabakov - 'Okho' meaning window in Russian, behind the 'pane' of the bottle, the artist shows us another world: whirling to infinity, myriads of wings, bearing us off joyfully towards the realm of dreams and bliss, in a transparent allegory of the magic of a great wine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2002
Description: Label art by Ilya Kabakov - 'Okho' meaning window in Russian, behind the 'pane' of the bottle, the artist shows us another world: whirling to infinity, myriads of wings, bearing us off joyfully towards the realm of dreams and bliss, in a transparent allegory of the magic of a great wine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2003
Description: 2003 marked the 150th anniversary of Mouton's entry into the Rothschild family. This label is dedicated to Baron Nathaniel de Rothschild, who acquired the estate on 11 May  1853. Baron Nathaniel's photograph is placed on the back, which is a close up of the estate's deed of purchase.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2003
Description: 2003 marked the 150th anniversary of Mouton's entry into the Rothschild family. This label is dedicated to Baron Nathaniel de Rothschild, who acquired the estate on 11 May  1853. Baron Nathaniel's photograph is placed on the back, which is a close up of the estate's deed of purchase.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2003
Description: 2003 marked the 150th anniversary of Mouton's entry into the Rothschild family. This label is dedicated to Baron Nathaniel de Rothschild, who acquired the estate on 11 May  1853. Baron Nathaniel's photograph is placed on the back, which is a close up of the estate's deed of purchase.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2004
Description: Celebration of the Centenary of the Entente Cordiale, concluded by Britain and France on 8 April 1904. Baroness Philippine de Rothschild approached HRH The Prince of Wales for an artwork. Illustrated watercolor  by the Prince, inspired by a French landscape.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2004
Description: Celebration of the Centenary of the Entente Cordiale, concluded by Britain and France on 8 April 1904. Baroness Philippine de Rothschild approached HRH The Prince of Wales for an artwork. Illustrated watercolor  by the Prince, inspired by a French landscape.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2004
Description: Celebration of the Centenary of the Entente Cordiale, concluded by Britain and France on 8 April 1904. Baroness Philippine de Rothschild approached HRH The Prince of Wales for an artwork. Illustrated watercolor  by the Prince, inspired by a French landscape.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2004
Description: Celebration of the Centenary of the Entente Cordiale, concluded by Britain and France on 8 April 1904. Baroness Philippine de Rothschild approached HRH The Prince of Wales for an artwork. Illustrated watercolor  by the Prince, inspired by a French landscape.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2005
Description: Label art by Giuseppe Penone - referencing the vine-grower's 'green finger', vines extending from the green hand. The hand will soon be grasping a glass of Mouton Rothschild.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2005
Description: Label art by Giuseppe Penone - referencing the vine-grower's 'green finger', vines extending from the green hand. The hand will soon be grasping a glass of Mouton Rothschild.

Description: Label art by Giuseppe Penone - referencing the vine-grower's 'green finger', vines extending from the green hand. The hand will soon be grasping a glass of Mouton Rothschild.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2005
Description: Label art by Giuseppe Penone - referencing the vine-grower's 'green finger', vines extending from the green hand. The hand will soon be grasping a glass of Mouton Rothschild.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2006
Description: For the 2006 label, Lucian Freud chose an exotic transposition of the pleasure of drinking where the vine stock is transformed into a springing palm tree and the wine lover into a zebra.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2006
Description: For the 2006 label, Lucian Freud chose an exotic transposition of the pleasure of drinking where the vine stock is transformed into a springing palm tree and the wine lover into a zebra.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2006
Description: For the 2006 label, Lucian Freud chose an exotic transposition of the pleasure of drinking where the vine stock is transformed into a springing palm tree and the wine lover into a zebra.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2007
Description: Label art by Bernar Venet - while suggesting the swell of a barrel, the arcs he has drawn evoke chalices rooted in the earth and open, like vinestocks, to the precious gifts from above.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2007
Description: Label art by Bernar Venet - while suggesting the swell of a barrel, the arcs he has drawn evoke chalices rooted in the earth and open, like vinestocks, to the precious gifts from above.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2007
Description: Label art by Bernar Venet - while suggesting the swell of a barrel, the arcs he has drawn evoke chalices rooted in the earth and open, like vinestocks, to the precious gifts from above.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2008
Description: Label art by Xu Lei - theme of the ram, emblem of the illustrious First Growth. Perched on top of a delicately delineated rock,  Xu Lei's ram asserts the role of a great wine as a link between people and cultures, from one hemisphere to the other of 'planet wine'.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2008
Description: Label art by Xu Lei - theme of the ram, emblem of the illustrious First Growth. Perched on top of a delicately delineated rock,  Xu Lei's ram asserts the role of a great wine as a link between people and cultures, from one hemisphere to the other of 'planet wine'.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2008
Description: Label art by Xu Lei - theme of the ram, emblem of the illustrious First Growth. Perched on top of a delicately delineated rock,  Xu Lei's ram asserts the role of a great wine as a link between people and cultures, from one hemisphere to the other of 'planet wine'.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2009
Description: Anish Kapoor was the author of this 2009 label. Austere, flamboyant and deep, the gouache created for Mouton Rothschild 2009 expresses a fertile thrust of plant life, the result of an intense encounter between matter and light.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2009
Description: Anish Kapoor was the author of this 2009 label. Austere, flamboyant and deep, the gouache created for Mouton Rothschild 2009 expresses a fertile thrust of plant life, the result of an intense encounter between matter and light.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2009
Description: Anish Kapoor was the author of this 2009 label. Austere, flamboyant and deep, the gouache created for Mouton Rothschild 2009 expresses a fertile thrust of plant life, the result of an intense encounter between matter and light.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2010
Description: Label art by Jeff Koons - for this label, he revisits Antiquity with a fresco from Pompeii: Birth of Venus. As the fresco turns into a Venus with Vessel. The Vessel is both the cup which holds the ship which, under a bright sun, bears off into the distance with the most exquisite of wines.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2010
Description: Label art by Jeff Koons - for this label, he revisits Antiquity with a fresco from Pompeii: Birth of Venus. As the fresco turns into a Venus with Vessel. The Vessel is both the cup which holds the ship which, under a bright sun, bears off into the distance with the most exquisite of wines.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2010
Description: Label art by Jeff Koons - for this label, he revisits Antiquity with a fresco from Pompeii: Birth of Venus. As the fresco turns into a Venus with Vessel. The Vessel is both the cup which holds the ship which, under a bright sun, bears off into the distance with the most exquisite of wines.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2011
Description: Label art by Guy de Rougemont - A red-dark color, symbolizing the darkness of a wine cellar to the brightness of sunny vineyards, the work of Rougemont takes us on a journey through the different steps of producing a fine wine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2011
Description: Label art by Guy de Rougemont - A red-dark color, symbolizing the darkness of a wine cellar to the brightness of sunny vineyards, the work of Rougemont takes us on a journey through the different steps of producing a fine wine.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2012
Description: Label art by Miquel Barceló - The historic emblem of the Mouton Rothschild estate is two rams symmetrically disposed and facing each other. They remind us the importance of balance and harmony in a great wine, which is a gift from nature.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2012
Description: Label art by Miquel Barceló - The historic emblem of the Mouton Rothschild estate is two rams symmetrically disposed and facing each other. They remind us the importance of balance and harmony in a great wine, which is a gift from nature.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2013
Description: Label art for the 2013 vintage was signed by Lee Ufan, a Korean artist and philosopher born in 1936. Under the purple red shape, the richness of a fine wine is hidden. Much like how wines are brought to life by the patience and secrecy of a cellar’s fermenting room.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2013
Description: Label art for the 2013 vintage was signed by Lee Ufan, a Korean artist and philosopher born in 1936. Under the purple red shape, the richness of a fine wine is hidden. Much like how wines are brought to life by the patience and secrecy of a cellar’s fermenting room.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2013
Description: Label art for the 2013 vintage was signed by Lee Ufan, a Korean artist and philosopher born in 1936. Under the purple red shape, the richness of a fine wine is hidden. Much like how wines are brought to life by the patience and secrecy of a cellar’s fermenting room.

Name: Mouton Rothschild Pauillac 2014
Description: The year 2014 was marked by the passing of Baronne Philippine de Rothschild, the owner of the Mouton Rothschild estate since 1988. The label was a tribute to her, signed by her close personal friend David Hockney. Two glasses, one empty and the other filled, radiating light, which represents joy and astonishment. This piece tells the eternal miracle of the long awaited birth of a certain fine wine: Chateau Mouton Rothschild.
